arabicText: إِذْ قَالُوا۟ لَيُوسُفُ وَأَخُوهُ أَحَبُّ إِلَىٰٓ أَبِينَا مِنَّا وَنَحْنُ عُصْبَةٌ إِنَّ أَبَانَا لَفِى ضَلَـٰلٍۢ مُّبِينٍ
englishTranslationText:
When	 they	 said,	 “Indeed	 Yusuf	 and	 his	
brother	*	are	dearer	to	our	father	than	we	
are,	 and	 we	 are	 one	 group;	 undoubtedly	
our	 father	is,	clearly,	deeply	engrossed	in	
love.”	(*	Of	the	same	mother.)
romanUrduTranslationText:
Jab	 bole	 ke	 zaroor	 Yūsuf aur	 us	 ka	 bhāi	
hamāre	 bāp ko	 ham	 se	 ziyādah	 piyāre	
haiñ	 aur	 ham	 ek	 jamā’at	 haiñ	 be-shak		
hamāre	 bāp	 sarāhatan	 in	 ki	 mahabbat	
meiñ	doobe	huye	haiñ

arabicText: ٱقْتُلُوا۟ يُوسُفَ أَوِ ٱطْرَحُوهُ أَرْضًۭا يَخْلُ لَكُمْ وَجْهُ أَبِيكُمْ وَتَكُونُوا۟ مِنۢ بَعْدِهِۦ قَوْمًۭا صَـٰلِحِينَ
englishTranslationText:
“Kill	Yusuf	or	throw	him	somewhere	in	the	
land,	so	that	your	father’s	attention	may	be	
directed	only	towards	you,	and	then	after	it	
you	may	again	become	righteous!”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Yūsuf ko	mār	dālo	 ya	 kahiñ	zameen	meiñ	
pheñk	 āao	 ke	 tumhāre	 bāp	 ka	 muñh	 sirf	
tumhāri	 hi	 taraf	 rahe	 aur	 us	 ke	 b’ad	 phir	
nek	ho	jānā

arabicText: قَالَ قَآئِلٌۭ مِّنْهُمْ لَا تَقْتُلُوا۟ يُوسُفَ وَأَلْقُوهُ فِى غَيَـٰبَتِ ٱلْجُبِّ يَلْتَقِطْهُ بَعْضُ ٱلسَّيَّارَةِ إِن كُنتُمْ فَـٰعِلِينَ
englishTranslationText:
A	 speaker	 among	 them	 said,	 “Do	 not	 kill	
Yusuf	- and	drop	him	into	a	dark	well	so	 that	some	 traveller	may	come	and	 take	him	away,	if	
you	have	to.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Un	 meiñ	 ek	 kahne	 wāla	 bolā	 Yūsuf ko	
māro	nahiñ	aur	usey	andhe	 (gehre	 tāreek)	kuñey	meiñ	dāl	do	ke	koi	rāh	chaltā	usey	āakar	le	
jāye	agar	tumheiñ	karnā	hai

arabicText: قَالُوا۟ يَـٰٓأَبَانَا مَا لَكَ لَا تَأْمَ۫نَّا عَلَىٰ يُوسُفَ وَإِنَّا لَهُۥ لَنَـٰصِحُونَ
englishTranslationText:
They	 said,	 “O	 our	 father!	 What	 is	 the	 matter	 with	 you	 that	 you	 do	 not	 trust	 us	 with	 Yusuf,	
although	we	are	in	fact	his	well-wishers?”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Bole	aey	hamāre	bāp!	Āap	ko	kyā	huā	ke	Yūsuf ke	mu’āmle	meiñ	hamārā	e’atibār	nahiñ	karte	
aur	ham	to	is	ke khair	khwāh	haiñ

arabicText: أَرْسِلْهُ مَعَنَا غَدًۭا يَرْتَعْ وَيَلْعَبْ وَإِنَّا لَهُۥ لَحَـٰفِظُونَ
englishTranslationText:
“Send	him	with	us	 tomorrow	so	 that	he	may	eat	some	 fruits	and	play,	and	indeed	we	are	his	
protectors.”
romanUrduTranslationText: Kal	isey	hamāre	sāth	bhej	dijiye	ke	mewe	khāye	aur	khele	aur	be-shak		ham	is	ke	nigehbān	haiñ

arabicText: قَالَ إِنِّى لَيَحْزُنُنِىٓ أَن تَذْهَبُوا۟ بِهِۦ وَأَخَافُ أَن يَأْكُلَهُ ٱلذِّئْبُ وَأَنتُمْ عَنْهُ غَـٰفِلُونَ
englishTranslationText:
He	 said,	 “I	 will	 indeed	 be	 saddened	 by	 your	 taking	 him	 away,	 and	 I	 fear	 that	 the	 wolf	 may	
devour	 him,	 whilst	 you	 are	 unaware	 of	 him.”	 (*	 Prophet	 Yaqub	 knew	 of	 what	 was	 about	 to	
happen.)
romanUrduTranslationText:
Bolā	be-shak		mujhe	ranj	degā	ke	tum	usey	le	jāo	aur	dartā	hooñ	ke	isey	bhediyā	khāle	aur	tum	
is	se	be	khabar	raho

arabicText: قَالُوا۟ لَئِنْ أَكَلَهُ ٱلذِّئْبُ وَنَحْنُ عُصْبَةٌ إِنَّآ إِذًۭا لَّخَـٰسِرُونَ
englishTranslationText: They	said,	“If	the	wolf	devours	him,	whereas	we	are	a	group,	then	surely	we	are	useless!”
romanUrduTranslationText: Bole	agar	bhediyā	khā	jāye	aur	ham	ek	jamā’at	haiñ	jab	to	ham	kisi	masraf	(kām)	ke	nahiñ

arabicText: فَلَمَّا ذَهَبُوا۟ بِهِۦ وَأَجْمَعُوٓا۟ أَن يَجْعَلُوهُ فِى غَيَـٰبَتِ ٱلْجُبِّ ۚ وَأَوْحَيْنَآ إِلَيْهِ لَتُنَبِّئَنَّهُم بِأَمْرِهِمْ هَـٰذَا وَهُمْ لَا يَشْعُرُونَ
englishTranslationText:
So	when	 they	 took	 him	 away	- and	 all	 of	
them	agreed	that	they	should	drop	him	in	
the	 dark	 well;	 and	 We	 sent	 the	 divine	
revelation	 to	 him,	 “You	 will	 surely	 tell	
them	 of	 their	 deed	 at	 a	 time	 when	 they	
will	not	know.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Phir	jab	usey	le	gaye	aur	sab	ki	rāye	yahi	
thahari	 ke	 isey	 andhe	 (tāreek	 gehre)	
kuñey	meiñ	dāl	deñ	aur	ham	ne	usey	waḥi	
bheji	 ke	 zaroor	 tu	 unheiñ	 un	 ka	 yeh	 kām	
jatā	 dega	 aise	 waqt	 ke	 woh	 na	 jānte	 hoñ	
ge

arabicText: وَجَآءُوٓ أَبَاهُمْ عِشَآءًۭ يَبْكُونَ
englishTranslationText:
And	at	nightfall	they	came	to	their	 father,	
weeping.
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	rāt	huye	apne	bāp	ke	pās	rote	āye

arabicText: قَالُوا۟ يَـٰٓأَبَانَآ إِنَّا ذَهَبْنَا نَسْتَبِقُ وَتَرَكْنَا يُوسُفَ عِندَ مَتَـٰعِنَا فَأَكَلَهُ ٱلذِّئْبُ ۖ وَمَآ أَنتَ بِمُؤْمِنٍۢ لَّنَا وَلَوْ كُنَّا صَـٰدِقِينَ
englishTranslationText:
Saying,	 “O	 our	 father!	We	went	 far	ahead	
while	 racing,	 and	 left	 Yusuf	 near	 our	
resources	 - therefore	 the	 wolf	 devoured	
him;	and	you	will	not	believe	us	although	
we	may	be	truthful.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
. Bole	 aey	 hamāre	 bāp!	 Ham	 daud	 karte	
nikal	gaye	aur	Yūsuf ko	apne	asbāb	ke	pās	
chordā	 to	usey	 bhediyā	 khā	gayā	aur	āap	
kisi	 tarah	hamārā	 yaqin	na	kareñ	ge	agar	
che	ham	sachche	hoñ

arabicText: وَجَآءُو عَلَىٰ قَمِيصِهِۦ بِدَمٍۢ كَذِبٍۢ ۚ قَالَ بَلْ سَوَّلَتْ لَكُمْ أَنفُسُكُمْ أَمْرًۭا ۖ فَصَبْرٌۭ جَمِيلٌۭ ۖ وَٱللَّهُ ٱلْمُسْتَعَانُ عَلَىٰ مَا تَصِفُونَ
englishTranslationText:
And	 they	 brought	 his	 shirt	 stained	 with	
faked	 blood;	 he	 said,	 “On	 the	 contrary	 -
your	hearts	have	 fabricated	an	excuse	 for	
you;	 therefore	 patience	 is	 better;	 and	
from	 Allah only	 I	 seek	 help	 against	 the	
matters	that	you	relate.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	us	ke	kurte	par	ek	jhootā	khoon	lagā	
lāye balke	 tumhāre	 diloñ	 ne	 ek	 bāt	
tumhāre	waste	banā	li	hai	 to	sabr	achcha	
aur	 Allāh	 hi	 se	 madad	 chāhtā	 hooñ	 un	
bātoñ	par	jo	tum	batā	rahe	ho

arabicText: وَجَآءَتْ سَيَّارَةٌۭ فَأَرْسَلُوا۟ وَارِدَهُمْ فَأَدْلَىٰ دَلْوَهُۥ ۖ قَالَ يَـٰبُشْرَىٰ هَـٰذَا غُلَـٰمٌۭ ۚ وَأَسَرُّوهُ بِضَـٰعَةًۭ ۚ وَٱللَّهُ عَلِيمٌۢ بِمَا يَعْمَلُونَ
englishTranslationText:
And	 there	 came	 a	 caravan	- so	 they	 sent	
their	water-drawer,	he	 therefore	lowered	
his	pail;	he	said,	“What	good	luck,	this	is	a	
boy!”;	and	they	hid	him	as	a	treasure;	and	
Allah knows	what	they	do.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	ek	qāflā	āayā	unhoñ	ne	apnā	pani	lāne		
wāla	 bhejā	 to	 us	 ne	 apnā	 dol	 dālā	 bolā	
āahā	 kaisi	 khushi	 ki	 bāt	 hai	 yeh	 to	 ek	
ladkā	 hai	 aur	 usey	 ek	 pooñji	 banā	 kar	
chupā	liyā	aur	Allāh	jānta	hai	jo	woh	karte	
haiñ

arabicText: وَشَرَوْهُ بِثَمَنٍۭ بَخْسٍۢ دَرَٰهِمَ مَعْدُودَةٍۢ وَكَانُوا۟ فِيهِ مِنَ ٱلزَّٰهِدِينَ
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	 bhāiyoñ	 ne	 usey	 khote	 dāmoñ	 ginti	 ke	 rupoñ	 par	 beñch	 dālā	 aur	 unheiñ	 us	meiñ	 kuchh		
raghbat	na	thi

arabicText: وَقَالَ ٱلَّذِى ٱشْتَرَىٰهُ مِن مِّصْرَ لِٱمْرَأَتِهِۦٓ أَكْرِمِى مَثْوَىٰهُ عَسَىٰٓ أَن يَنفَعَنَآ أَوْ نَتَّخِذَهُۥ وَلَدًۭا ۚ وَكَذَٰلِكَ مَكَّنَّا لِيُوسُفَ فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ وَلِنُعَلِّمَهُۥ مِن تَأْوِيلِ ٱلْأَحَادِيثِ ۚ وَٱللَّهُ غَالِبٌ عَلَىٰٓ أَمْرِهِۦ وَلَـٰكِنَّ أَكْثَرَ ٱلنَّاسِ لَا يَعْلَمُونَ
englishTranslationText:
And	the	Egyptian	who	purchased	him	said	to	his	wife,	“Keep	him	honourably	- we	may	derive	
some	benefit	due	to	him	or	we	may	adopt	him	as	our	son”;	and	this	is	how	we	established	Yusuf	
in the	land,	and	that	We	might	teach	him	how	to	interpret	events;	and	Allah is	Dominant	upon	
His	works,	but	most	men	do	not	know.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	Misr ke	jis	shakhs	ne	usey	kharidā	woh	apni’aurat	se	bolā	inheiñ	‘izzat	se	rakh	shāyad	in	se	
hameiñ	 naf’a	 pahuñche	 ya	in	 ko	 ham	 betā	 banā	leñ	aur	isi	 tarah	 ham	 ne	Yūsuf ko	 us	 zameen	
meiñ	jamāo	(rehne	ko	thikāna)	diyā	aur	is	liye	ke	usey	bātoñ	ka	anjām	sikhāyeñ	aur	Allāh	apne	
kām	par	ghālib	hai	magar	aksar	ādmi	nahiñ	jānte.

arabicText: وَلَمَّا بَلَغَ أَشُدَّهُۥٓ ءَاتَيْنَـٰهُ حُكْمًۭا وَعِلْمًۭا ۚ وَكَذَٰلِكَ نَجْزِى ٱلْمُحْسِنِينَ
englishTranslationText:
And	when	he	matured	to	his	full	strength,	We	bestowed	him	wisdom	and	knowledge;	and	this	is	
how	We	reward	the	virtuous.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	jab	apni	poori	quwwat	ko	pahuñchā	ham	ne	usey	ḥukm	aur	‘ilm	‘atā	farmāyā	aur	ham	aisa	
hi	sila	dete	haiñ	nekoñ	ko.

arabicText: وَرَٰوَدَتْهُ ٱلَّتِى هُوَ فِى بَيْتِهَا عَن نَّفْسِهِۦ وَغَلَّقَتِ ٱلْأَبْوَٰبَ وَقَالَتْ هَيْتَ لَكَ ۚ قَالَ مَعَاذَ ٱللَّهِ ۖ إِنَّهُۥ رَبِّىٓ أَحْسَنَ مَثْوَاىَ ۖ إِنَّهُۥ لَا يُفْلِحُ ٱلظَّـٰلِمُونَ
englishTranslationText:
And	 the	 woman	 in	 whose	 house	 he	 was,	
allured	 him	 not	 to	 restrain	 himself	 and	
she	closed	all	the	doors	- and	said,	“Come!	
It	is	you	I	address!”;	he	said,	“(I	seek)	The	
refuge	 of	 Allah - indeed	 the	 governor	 is	
my	 master	 - he	 treats	 me	 well;	
undoubtedly	the	unjust	never	prosper.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	woh	jis	áurat	ke	ghar	meiñ	 thā	us	ne	
usey	 lubhāyā	 ke	 apnā	 āapā	 na	 roke	 aur	
darwāze	 sab	 band	 kar	 diye	 aur	 boli	 āao	
tumhiñ	se	kehti	hooñ	kahā	Allāh	ki	panāh	
woh	 ‘aziz to	 merā	 Rab	 y’ani	 parwarish		
karne		wāla	hai	us	ne	mujhe	achchi	 tarah	
rakhā	 be-shak	 zālimoñ	 ka	 bhalā	 nahiñ	
hotā

arabicText: وَرَٰوَدَتْهُ ٱلَّتِى هُوَ فِى بَيْتِهَا عَن نَّفْسِهِۦ وَغَلَّقَتِ ٱلْأَبْوَٰبَ وَقَالَتْ هَيْتَ لَكَ ۚ قَالَ مَعَاذَ ٱللَّهِ ۖ إِنَّهُۥ رَبِّىٓ أَحْسَنَ مَثْوَاىَ ۖ إِنَّهُۥ لَا يُفْلِحُ ٱلظَّـٰلِمُونَ
englishTranslationText:
And	 the	 woman	 in	 whose	 house	 he	 was,	
allured	 him	 not	 to	 restrain	 himself	 and	
she	closed	all	the	doors	- and	said,	“Come!	
It	is	you	I	address!”;	he	said,	“(I	seek)	The	
refuge	 of	 Allah - indeed	 the	 governor	 is	
my	 master	 - he	 treats	 me	 well;	
undoubtedly	the	unjust	never	prosper.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	woh	jis	áurat	ke	ghar	meiñ	 thā	us	ne	
usey	 lubhāyā	 ke	 apnā	 āapā	 na	 roke	 aur	
darwāze	 sab	 band	 kar	 diye	 aur	 boli	 āao	
tumhiñ	se	kehti	hooñ	kahā	Allāh	ki	panāh	
woh	 ‘aziz to	 merā	 Rab	 y’ani	 parwarish		
karne		wāla	hai	us	ne	mujhe	achchi	 tarah	
rakhā	 be-shak	 zālimoñ	 ka	 bhalā	 nahiñ	
hotā

arabicText: وَلَقَدْ هَمَّتْ بِهِۦ ۖ وَهَمَّ بِهَا لَوْلَآ أَن رَّءَا بُرْهَـٰنَ رَبِّهِۦ ۚ كَذَٰلِكَ لِنَصْرِفَ عَنْهُ ٱلسُّوٓءَ وَٱلْفَحْشَآءَ ۚ إِنَّهُۥ مِنْ عِبَادِنَا ٱلْمُخْلَصِينَ
englishTranslationText:
And	indeed	 the	 woman	 desired	 him;	 and	
he	 too	 would	 have	 desired	 her	 were	 he	
not	to	witness	the	sign	of	his	Lord	*;	this	is	
what	 We	 did,	 to	 turn	 away	 evil	 and	
lewdness	 from	 him;	 indeed	 He	 is	 one	 of	
Our	 chosen	 bondmen.	(*	 Allah saved	 him	
and	he	never	desired	this	immorality.)
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	 be-shak	 ‘aurat	 ne	 us	 ka	 irādah	 kiya	
aur	 woh	 bhi	 ‘aurat	 ka	 irādah	 kartā	 agar	
apne	Rab	ki	dalil	na	dekh	letā	ham	ne	yuñ	
hi	kiya	ke	us	se	burāi	aur	be-hayāi	ko	pher	
deñ be-shak who	 hamāre	 chune	 huye	
bandoñ	meiñ	se	hai

arabicText: وَٱسْتَبَقَا ٱلْبَابَ وَقَدَّتْ قَمِيصَهُۥ مِن دُبُرٍۢ وَأَلْفَيَا سَيِّدَهَا لَدَا ٱلْبَابِ ۚ قَالَتْ مَا جَزَآءُ مَنْ أَرَادَ بِأَهْلِكَ سُوٓءًا إِلَّآ أَن يُسْجَنَ أَوْ عَذَابٌ أَلِيمٌۭ
englishTranslationText:
And	 they	 both	 raced	 towards	 the	 door,	
and	the	woman	tore	his	shirt	from	behind,	
and	 they	 both	 found	 her	 husband	 at	 the	
door;	she	said,	“What	is	the	punishment	of	
the	 one	 who	 sought	 evil	 with	 your	 wife,	
other	than	prison	or	a	painful	torture?”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	 donoñ	 darwāze	 ki	 taraf	 daude	 aur	
‘aurat	 ne	 us	 ka	 kurtā	 peeche	 se	 chir	 liyā	
aur	donoñ	ko	‘aurat	ka	miyāñ	darwāze	ke	
pās	milā	 boli	 kya	 sazā	 hai	is	 ki	jis	 ne	 teri	
ghar	wāli	se	badi	chāhi	magar	yeh	ke	qaid	
kiya	jāye	ya	dukh	ki	mār

arabicText: قَالَ هِىَ رَٰوَدَتْنِى عَن نَّفْسِى ۚ وَشَهِدَ شَاهِدٌۭ مِّنْ أَهْلِهَآ إِن كَانَ قَمِيصُهُۥ قُدَّ مِن قُبُلٍۢ فَصَدَقَتْ وَهُوَ مِنَ ٱلْكَـٰذِبِينَ
englishTranslationText:
Said	Yusuf,	“It	was	she	who	lured	me,	that	
I	 may	 not	 guard	 myself”	- and	 a	 witness	
from	 her	 own	 household	 testified;	 “If	 his	
shirt	 is	 torn	 from	 the	 front,	 then	 the	
woman	 is	 truthful	 and	 he	 has	 spoken	
incorrectly.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Kahā	is	ne	mujh	ko	lubhāyā	ke	maiñ	apni	
hifāzat	na	karooñ	aur	‘aurat	ke	ghar	meiñ	
se	ek	gawāh	ne	gawāhi	di	agar	in	ka	kurtā	āage	se	chirā	to	‘aurat	sachchi	hai	aur	inhoñ	ne	ghalat	
kahā

arabicText: وَإِن كَانَ قَمِيصُهُۥ قُدَّ مِن دُبُرٍۢ فَكَذَبَتْ وَهُوَ مِنَ ٱلصَّـٰدِقِينَ
englishTranslationText: “And	if	his	shirt	is	torn	from	behind,	then	the	woman is	a	liar	and	he	is	truthful.”
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur agar	in	ka	kurtā	peeche	se	chāk	huā	to	‘aurat	jhooti	hai	aur	yeh	sachche

arabicText: فَلَمَّا رَءَا قَمِيصَهُۥ قُدَّ مِن دُبُرٍۢ قَالَ إِنَّهُۥ مِن كَيْدِكُنَّ ۖ إِنَّ كَيْدَكُنَّ عَظِيمٌۭ
englishTranslationText:
So	when	 the	governor	 saw	 his	 shirt	 torn	 from	 behind,	 he	 said,	 “Indeed	 this	is	a	 deception	 of	
women;	undoubtedly	the	deception	of	women	is	very	great.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
“O	Yusuf!	Disregard	 this	- and	O	woman!	Seek	 forgiveness	 for	your	sin;	indeed	you	are	of	 the	
mistaken.”

arabicText: يُوسُفُ أَعْرِضْ عَنْ هَـٰذَا ۚ وَٱسْتَغْفِرِى لِذَنۢبِكِ ۖ إِنَّكِ كُنتِ مِنَ ٱلْخَاطِـِٔينَ
englishTranslationText:
“O	Yusuf!	Disregard	 this	- and	O	woman!	Seek	 forgiveness	 for	your	sin;	indeed	you	are	of	 the	
mistaken.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aey	Yūsuf!	Tum	is	ka	khayāl	na	karo	aur	aey	‘aurat!	Tu	apne	gunāh	ki	mu’āfi	māng	be-shak	tu	
khatā	wāroñ	meiñ	hai

arabicText: ۞ وَقَالَ نِسْوَةٌۭ فِى ٱلْمَدِينَةِ ٱمْرَأَتُ ٱلْعَزِيزِ تُرَٰوِدُ فَتَىٰهَا عَن نَّفْسِهِۦ ۖ قَدْ شَغَفَهَا حُبًّا ۖ إِنَّا لَنَرَىٰهَا فِى ضَلَـٰلٍۢ مُّبِينٍۢ
englishTranslationText:
And	some	women	of	the	city	said,	“The	governor’s	wife	is	seducing	her	young	slave;	indeed	his	
love	has	taken	root	in	her	heart;	and	we	find	her	clearly	lost.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	shaher	meiñ	kuchh	‘aurateñ	boliñ	ke	‘aziz	ki	bibi	apne	nau-jawān	ka	dil	lubhāti	hai	be-shak		
un	ki	mahabbat	us	ke	dil	meiñ	pair	(samā)	gayi	hai	ham	to	usey	sarih	khud	rafta	pāte	haiñ

arabicText: فَلَمَّا سَمِعَتْ بِمَكْرِهِنَّ أَرْسَلَتْ إِلَيْهِنَّ وَأَعْتَدَتْ لَهُنَّ مُتَّكَـًۭٔا وَءَاتَتْ كُلَّ وَٰحِدَةٍۢ مِّنْهُنَّ سِكِّينًۭا وَقَالَتِ ٱخْرُجْ عَلَيْهِنَّ ۖ فَلَمَّا رَأَيْنَهُۥٓ أَكْبَرْنَهُۥ وَقَطَّعْنَ أَيْدِيَهُنَّ وَقُلْنَ حَـٰشَ لِلَّهِ مَا هَـٰذَا بَشَرًا إِنْ هَـٰذَآ إِلَّا مَلَكٌۭ كَرِيمٌۭ
englishTranslationText:
And	 when	 she	 heard	 of	 their	 secret	 talk,	
she	sent	for	them	and	prepared	cushioned	
mattresses	 for	 them	 and	 gave	 a	 knife	 to	
each	one	of	them	and	said	to	Yusuf,	“Come	
out	 before	 them!”	When	 the	 women	 saw	
him	they	praised	him	and	cut	their	hands,	
and	 said,	 “Purity	 is	 to	 Allah - this	 is	 no	
human	 being;	 this	 is	 not	 but	 an	
honourable	angel!”
romanUrduTranslationText:
To	 jab	 Zulaikhā	 ne	 un	 ka	 chakarwā	 (che	
mi goi wa t’ān)	 sunā	 to	 un	 ‘auratoñ	 ko	
bulā	bhejā	aur	un	ke	liye	masnadeñ	tayyār	
kiñ	aur	un	meiñ	har	ek	ko	ek	chhuri	di	aur	
Yūsuf se	kahā	in	par	nikal	āao	jab	‘auratoñ	
ne	Yūsuf ko	dekhā	us	ki	badai	bolne	lagiñ	
aur	 apne	 hāth	 kat	liye	 aur	 boliñ	 Allāh	 ko	
pāki	 hai	 yeh	 to	jinse bashar	 se	 nahiñ	 yeh	
to	nahiñ	magar	mu’azzaz	farishtā	.

arabicText: قَالَتْ فَذَٰلِكُنَّ ٱلَّذِى لُمْتُنَّنِى فِيهِ ۖ وَلَقَدْ رَٰوَدتُّهُۥ عَن نَّفْسِهِۦ فَٱسْتَعْصَمَ ۖ وَلَئِن لَّمْ يَفْعَلْ مَآ ءَامُرُهُۥ لَيُسْجَنَنَّ وَلَيَكُونًۭا مِّنَ ٱلصَّـٰغِرِينَ
englishTranslationText:
She	said,	“This	is	he	on	whose	account	you	
used	 to	 insult	 me;	 and	 indeed	 I	 tried	 to	
entice	him,	so	he	safeguarded	himself;	and	
indeed	if	he	does	not	do	what	I	tell	him	to,	
he	 will	 surely	 be	 imprisoned,	 and	 will	
surely	be	humiliated.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Zulaikhā	ne	kahā	 to	 yeh	haiñ	woh	jin	par	
tum	 mujhe	 t’āna	 deti	 thiñ	 aur	 be-shak		
maiñ	ne	in	ka	jee	lubhānā	chāhā	 to	inhoñ	
ne	apne	āap	ko	bachāyā	aur	be-shak		agar	
woh	 yeh	 kām	 na	 kareñ	 ge	 jo	 maiñ	 in	 se	
kehti	 hooñ	 to	 zaroor	 qaid	meiñ	 padeñ	ge	
aur	woh	zaroor	zillat	uthāeñ	ge

arabicText: قَالَ رَبِّ ٱلسِّجْنُ أَحَبُّ إِلَىَّ مِمَّا يَدْعُونَنِىٓ إِلَيْهِ ۖ وَإِلَّا تَصْرِفْ عَنِّى كَيْدَهُنَّ أَصْبُ إِلَيْهِنَّ وَأَكُن مِّنَ ٱلْجَـٰهِلِينَ
englishTranslationText:
He	 said,	 “O	 my	 Lord!	 Prison	 is	 dearer	 to	
me	than	the	deed	they	invite	me	to;	and	if	
You	 do	 not	 repel	 their	 deceit	 away	 from	
me,	 I	 may	 incline	 towards	 them	 and	 be	
unwise.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Yūsuf ne	‘arz	ki	aye	mere	Rab	mujhe	qaid	
khāna	ziyādah	pasand	hai	us	kām	se	jis	ki	
taraf	 yeh	 mujhe	 bulāti	 haiñ	 aur	 agar	 tu	
mujh	se	in	ka	makr	na	phere	gā	to	maiñ	in	
ki	 taraf	 	 mā’il	 houñgā	 aur	 nādān	 banooñ	
gā

arabicText: فَٱسْتَجَابَ لَهُۥ رَبُّهُۥ فَصَرَفَ عَنْهُ كَيْدَهُنَّ ۚ إِنَّهُۥ هُوَ ٱلسَّمِيعُ ٱلْعَلِيمُ
englishTranslationText:
So	his	Lord	heard	his	prayer	and	repelled	
the	 women’s	 deceit	 away	 from	 him;	
indeed	He	 only	is	 the	All	Hearing,	 the	All	
Knowing.
romanUrduTranslationText:
. To	 us	 ke	 Rab	 ne	 us	 ki	 sun	 li	 aur	 us	 se	
áuratoñ	ka	makr	pher	diyā	be-shak		wohi	
suntā	jānta	hai

arabicText: ثُمَّ بَدَا لَهُم مِّنۢ بَعْدِ مَا رَأَوُا۟ ٱلْـَٔايَـٰتِ لَيَسْجُنُنَّهُۥ حَتَّىٰ حِينٍۢ
englishTranslationText:
Then	after	having	seeing	all	the	signs,	they	
all	 decided	 that	 he	 should	 be	imprisoned	
for	some	time.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Phir	sab	kuch		nishaniyañ	dekh	dikhā	kar	
pichli	mat	inheiñ	yahi	āayi (yahi	munāsib	
samjhā)	 ke	 zaroor	 ek	 muddat	 tak	 qaid	
khāne	meiñ	dāleñ

arabicText: وَدَخَلَ مَعَهُ ٱلسِّجْنَ فَتَيَانِ ۖ قَالَ أَحَدُهُمَآ إِنِّىٓ أَرَىٰنِىٓ أَعْصِرُ خَمْرًۭا ۖ وَقَالَ ٱلْـَٔاخَرُ إِنِّىٓ أَرَىٰنِىٓ أَحْمِلُ فَوْقَ رَأْسِى خُبْزًۭا تَأْكُلُ ٱلطَّيْرُ مِنْهُ ۖ نَبِّئْنَا بِتَأْوِيلِهِۦٓ ۖ إِنَّا نَرَىٰكَ مِنَ ٱلْمُحْسِنِينَ
englishTranslationText:
And	two	young	men	went	to	prison	along	
with	him;	one	of	them	said,	“I	dreamt	that	I	am	pressing	wine”;	the	other	said,	“I	dreamt	that	I	
am	 carrying	 some	 bread	 upon	 my	 head	 from	 which	 birds	 were	 eating”;	 “Tell	 us	 their	
interpretation;	indeed	we	see	that	you	are	virtuous.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	us	ke	sāth	qaid	khāne	meiñ	do	jawān	dākhil	huye	un	meiñ	ek	bolā	ke	maiñ	ne	khwāb	dekhā	
ke	sharāb	nichodtā	hooñ	aur	doosrā	bolā	maiñ	ne	khwāb	dekhā	ke	mere	sar	par	kuch rotiyāñ	
haiñ	 jin	 meiñ	 se	 parind	 khāte	 haiñ	 hameiñ	 is	 ki	 t’abir	 batāiye	 be-shak	 ham	 āp	 ko	 nekokār	
dekhte	haiñ

arabicText: قَالَ لَا يَأْتِيكُمَا طَعَامٌۭ تُرْزَقَانِهِۦٓ إِلَّا نَبَّأْتُكُمَا بِتَأْوِيلِهِۦ قَبْلَ أَن يَأْتِيَكُمَا ۚ ذَٰلِكُمَا مِمَّا عَلَّمَنِى رَبِّىٓ ۚ إِنِّى تَرَكْتُ مِلَّةَ قَوْمٍۢ لَّا يُؤْمِنُونَ بِٱللَّهِ وَهُم بِٱلْـَٔاخِرَةِ هُمْ كَـٰفِرُونَ
englishTranslationText:
Said	Yusuf,	“The	food	which	you	get	will	not	reach	you,	but	I	will	tell	you	the	interpretation	of	
this	before	it	comes	to	you;	this	is	one	of	the	sciences	my	Lord	has	taught	me;	indeed	I	did	not	
accept	the	religion	of	the	people	who	do	not	believe	in	Allah and	are	deniers	of	the	Hereafter.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Yūsuf ne	kahā	jo	khāna	tumheñ	milā	kartā	hai	woh	tumhāre	pās	na	āane	payega	ke	maiñ	is	ki	
t’ābeer	us	ke	āane	se	pehle	tumheñ	batā	dooñ	ga	yeh	un	‘ilmoñ	meiñ	se	hai	jo	mujhe	mere	Rab	
ne	sikhāyā	hai	be-shak		maiñ	ne	un	logoñ	ka	Deen	na	mānā	jo	Allāh	par	Imān	nahiñ	lāte	aur	woh	
Ākhirat ke	munkir	haiñ

arabicText: وَٱتَّبَعْتُ مِلَّةَ ءَابَآءِىٓ إِبْرَٰهِيمَ وَإِسْحَـٰقَ وَيَعْقُوبَ ۚ مَا كَانَ لَنَآ أَن نُّشْرِكَ بِٱللَّهِ مِن شَىْءٍۢ ۚ ذَٰلِكَ مِن فَضْلِ ٱللَّهِ عَلَيْنَا وَعَلَى ٱلنَّاسِ وَلَـٰكِنَّ أَكْثَرَ ٱلنَّاسِ لَا يَشْكُرُونَ
englishTranslationText:
“And	 I	 have	 chosen	 the	 religion	 of	 my	
forefathers,	Ibrahim	and	Ishaq	and	Yaqub;	
it	is	not	rightful	for	us	to	ascribe	anything	
as	 a partner	 to	 Allah;	 this	 is	 a	 grace	 of	
Allah upon	 us	 and	 upon	 mankind,	 but	
most	men	are	not	thankful.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	 maiñ	 ne	 apne	 bāp	 dādā	 Ibrāhim aur	
Ishāq aur	 Y’aqoob ka	 deen	 ikhtiyār	 kiya	
hameñ	 nahiñ	 pahuñchtā	 ke	 kisi	 cheez	 ko	
Allāh	ka	sharik	thahrāyeñ	yeh	Allāh	ka	ek	
fazl	 hai ham	 par	 aur	 logoñ	 par	 magar	
aksar	log	shukr	nahiñ	karte

arabicText: يَـٰصَـٰحِبَىِ ٱلسِّجْنِ ءَأَرْبَابٌۭ مُّتَفَرِّقُونَ خَيْرٌ أَمِ ٱللَّهُ ٱلْوَٰحِدُ ٱلْقَهَّارُ
englishTranslationText:
“O	 both	my	 fellow-prisoners!	Are	 various	
lords	 better,	 or	 One	 Allah,	 the	 Dominant	
above	all?”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aey	 mere	 qaid	 khāne	 ke	 donoñ	 sāthiyo!	
Kya	 judā	 judā	 Rab	 achche	 ya	 ek	 Allāh	 jo	
sab	par	ghālib

arabicText: مَا تَعْبُدُونَ مِن دُونِهِۦٓ إِلَّآ أَسْمَآءًۭ سَمَّيْتُمُوهَآ أَنتُمْ وَءَابَآؤُكُم مَّآ أَنزَلَ ٱللَّهُ بِهَا مِن سُلْطَـٰنٍ ۚ إِنِ ٱلْحُكْمُ إِلَّا لِلَّهِ ۚ أَمَرَ أَلَّا تَعْبُدُوٓا۟ إِلَّآ إِيَّاهُ ۚ ذَٰلِكَ ٱلدِّينُ ٱلْقَيِّمُ وَلَـٰكِنَّ أَكْثَرَ ٱلنَّاسِ لَا يَعْلَمُونَ
englishTranslationText:
. “You	 do	 not	 worship	 anything	 besides	
Him,	 but	which	are	merely	 names	 coined	
by	 you	 and	 your	 forefathers	 - Allah has	
not	sent	down	any	proof	regarding	 them;	
there	is	no	command	but	that	of	Allah;	He	
has	commanded	 that	 you	do	not	worship	
anyone	 except	 Him;	 this	 is	 the	 proper	
religion,	but	most	people	do	not	know.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Tum	 us	 ke	 siwā	 nahiñ	 poojte	 magar	 nire	
nām	jo	 tum	 ne	 aur	 tumhāre	 bāp	 dādā	 ne	
tarāsh	 liye	 haiñ	 Allāh ne	 un	 ki	 koi	 sanad	
na	utāri	ḥukm	nahiñ	magar	Allāh	ka	us	ne	
farmāyā	hai	ke	us	ke	siwā	kisi	ko	na	poojo	
yeh	 sidhā	Deen	 hai	 lekin	 aksar	 log	 nahiñ	
jānte

arabicText: يَـٰصَـٰحِبَىِ ٱلسِّجْنِ أَمَّآ أَحَدُكُمَا فَيَسْقِى رَبَّهُۥ خَمْرًۭا ۖ وَأَمَّا ٱلْـَٔاخَرُ فَيُصْلَبُ فَتَأْكُلُ ٱلطَّيْرُ مِن رَّأْسِهِۦ ۚ قُضِىَ ٱلْأَمْرُ ٱلَّذِى فِيهِ تَسْتَفْتِيَانِ
englishTranslationText:
“O	 my	 two	 fellow-prisoners!	 One	 of	 you	
will	give	his	lord	(the	king)	wine	to	drink;	
regarding	 the	 other,	 he	 will	 be	 crucified,	
therefore	birds	will	eat	from	his	head;	the	
command	 has	 been	 given	 concerning	 the	
matter	you	had	enquired	about.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aey	 qaid	 khāne	 ke	 donoñ	 sāthiyo	 tum	
meiñ	ek	 to	apne	rab	(bādshāh)	ko	sharāb	
pilāyega; rahā	 doosra, woh	 sooli	 diyā	
jayega, to	 parinde	 us	 ka	 sar	 khāyeñge;
ḥukm	ho	chukā	us	bāt	ka	jis	ka	tum	sawāl	
karte	the

arabicText: وَقَالَ لِلَّذِى ظَنَّ أَنَّهُۥ نَاجٍۢ مِّنْهُمَا ٱذْكُرْنِى عِندَ رَبِّكَ فَأَنسَىٰهُ ٱلشَّيْطَـٰنُ ذِكْرَ رَبِّهِۦ فَلَبِثَ فِى ٱلسِّجْنِ بِضْعَ سِنِينَ
englishTranslationText:
And	 of	 the	 two,	 Yusuf	 said	 to	 the	 one	
whom	 he	 sensed	 would	 be	 released,	
“Remember	me,	in	the	company	of	your	lord”;	so	Satan	caused	him	to	forget	to	mention	Yusuf	
to	his	lord,	he	therefore	stayed	in	prison	for	several	years	more.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	Yūsuf ne	un	donoñ	meiñ	se	jise	bachtā	samjhā	us	se	kahā	apne	rab	(bādshāh)	ke	pās	merā	
zikr	karnā	to	shaitān	ne	usey	bhulā	diyā	ke	apne	rab	(bādshāh)	ke sāmne	Yūsuf ka	zikr	kare	to	
Yūsuf kayi	baras	aur	jel	khāne	meiñ	rahā

arabicText: وَقَالَ ٱلْمَلِكُ إِنِّىٓ أَرَىٰ سَبْعَ بَقَرَٰتٍۢ سِمَانٍۢ يَأْكُلُهُنَّ سَبْعٌ عِجَافٌۭ وَسَبْعَ سُنۢبُلَـٰتٍ خُضْرٍۢ وَأُخَرَ يَابِسَـٰتٍۢ ۖ يَـٰٓأَيُّهَا ٱلْمَلَأُ أَفْتُونِى فِى رُءْيَـٰىَ إِن كُنتُمْ لِلرُّءْيَا تَعْبُرُونَ
englishTranslationText:
. And	 the	king	said,	 “I	saw	in	a	dream	seven	healthy	cows	whom	seven	lean	cows	were	eating,	
and	seven	green	ears	of	corn	and	seven	others	dry;	O	court-members!	Explain	my	dream,	if	you	
can	interpret	dreams.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	bādshāh	ne	kahā	maiñ	ne	khwāb	meiñ	dekhiñ	sāt	(7)	gāyeñ	farbah	(Moti	Tāzi)	ke	unheñ	sāt
(7) dubli	 gāyeñ	 khā	 rahi	 haiñ	 aur	 sāt	(7)	bāleñ	 hari	 aur	 doosri	 sāt	(7)	 sookhi	 aey	darbāriyo!	
Mere	khwāb	ka	jawāb	do	agar	tumheñ	khwāb	ki	t’ābeer	āti	ho

arabicText: قَالُوٓا۟ أَضْغَـٰثُ أَحْلَـٰمٍۢ ۖ وَمَا نَحْنُ بِتَأْوِيلِ ٱلْأَحْلَـٰمِ بِعَـٰلِمِينَ
englishTranslationText:
They	 answered,	 “These	 are	 confused	
dreams	 - and	 we	 do	 not	 know	 the	
interpretation	of	dreams.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Bole pareshān	 khwābeñ	 haiñ	 aur	 ham	
khwāb	ki	t’ābeer	nahiñ	jānte

arabicText: وَقَالَ ٱلَّذِى نَجَا مِنْهُمَا وَٱدَّكَرَ بَعْدَ أُمَّةٍ أَنَا۠ أُنَبِّئُكُم بِتَأْوِيلِهِۦ فَأَرْسِلُونِ
englishTranslationText:
And	of	the	two	the	one	who	was	released	
said	 - and	 after	 a	 long	 time	 he	 had	
remembered	 - “I	 will	 tell	 you	 its	
interpretation,	therefore	send	me	forth.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
. Aur	bolā	woh	jo	un	donoñ	meiñ se	bachā	
thā	 aur	 ek	 muddat	 b’ād	 usey	 yād	 āaya	
maiñ	tumheñ	is	ki	t’abeer	batāuñga	mujhe	
bhejo

arabicText: يُوسُفُ أَيُّهَا ٱلصِّدِّيقُ أَفْتِنَا فِى سَبْعِ بَقَرَٰتٍۢ سِمَانٍۢ يَأْكُلُهُنَّ سَبْعٌ عِجَافٌۭ وَسَبْعِ سُنۢبُلَـٰتٍ خُضْرٍۢ وَأُخَرَ يَابِسَـٰتٍۢ لَّعَلِّىٓ أَرْجِعُ إِلَى ٱلنَّاسِ لَعَلَّهُمْ يَعْلَمُونَ
englishTranslationText:
“O	 Yusuf!	 O	 truthful	 one!	 Explain	 for	 us	
the	seven	healthy	cows	which	seven	lean	
cows	 were	 eating	 and	 the	 seven	 green	
ears	 of	 corn	 and	 seven	 others	 dry,	 so	 I	
may	 return	 to	 the	 people,	 possibly	 they	
may	come	to	know.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aey	 Yūsuf!	 Aey	 Siddiq!	 Hameñ	 t’ābeer	
dijiye sāt	(7)	 farbah	 gāyoñ	 ki	 jinheiñ	 sāt
(7) dubli	khāti	haiñ	aur	sāt (7) hari	bāleñ	
aur	 doosri	 sāt	 (7)	 sookhi	 shāyad	 maiñ	
logoñ	 ki	 taraf	 laut	 kar	 jāooñ	 shāyad	 woh	
āgāh	hoñ

arabicText: قَالَ تَزْرَعُونَ سَبْعَ سِنِينَ دَأَبًۭا فَمَا حَصَدتُّمْ فَذَرُوهُ فِى سُنۢبُلِهِۦٓ إِلَّا قَلِيلًۭا مِّمَّا تَأْكُلُونَ
englishTranslationText:
He	said, “You	will	cultivate	for	seven	years	
continuously;	so	leave	all	that	you	harvest	
in	the	ear,	except	a	little	which	you	eat.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Kahā	 tum	 kheti	 karoge	 sāt (7) baras	
lagātār	 to	 jo	 kāto	 usey	 us	 ki	 bāl	 meiñ	
rehne	do	magar	thodā	jitnā	khā	lo

arabicText: ثُمَّ يَأْتِى مِنۢ بَعْدِ ذَٰلِكَ سَبْعٌۭ شِدَادٌۭ يَأْكُلْنَ مَا قَدَّمْتُمْ لَهُنَّ إِلَّا قَلِيلًۭا مِّمَّا تُحْصِنُونَ
englishTranslationText:
. “Then	 after	 that	 will	 come	 seven	 hard	
years	 which	 will	 devour	 all	 that	 you	 had	
stored	 for	 them,	except	a	little	which	you	
may	save.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Phir	 us	 ke	 b’ad	 sāt	 karre	 (Sakht	 tangi	
wāle) baras	 āyeñ	 ge	 ke	 khā	 jayeñ	 ge	 jo	
tum	 ne	 un	 ke	 liye	 pehle	 jam’a	 kar	 rakhā	
thā	magar	thodā	jo	bachā	lo

arabicText: ثُمَّ يَأْتِى مِنۢ بَعْدِ ذَٰلِكَ عَامٌۭ فِيهِ يُغَاثُ ٱلنَّاسُ وَفِيهِ يَعْصِرُونَ
englishTranslationText:
“Then	 after	 that	 will	 come	 a	 year	 when	
the	people	will	be	given	rain	and	in	which	
they	will	extract	juices.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Phir	 un	 ke	 b’ad	 ek	 baras	 āye	 ga	 jis	 meiñ	
logoñ	 ko	 meñh	 diyā	 jāye	 gā	 aur	 us	 meiñ	
ras	nichodeñ	ge

arabicText: وَقَالَ ٱلْمَلِكُ ٱئْتُونِى بِهِۦ ۖ فَلَمَّا جَآءَهُ ٱلرَّسُولُ قَالَ ٱرْجِعْ إِلَىٰ رَبِّكَ فَسْـَٔلْهُ مَا بَالُ ٱلنِّسْوَةِ ٱلَّـٰتِى قَطَّعْنَ أَيْدِيَهُنَّ ۚ إِنَّ رَبِّى بِكَيْدِهِنَّ عَلِيمٌۭ
englishTranslationText:
And	 the	 king	 said,	 “Bring	 him	 to	 me”;	 so	
when	the	bearer	came	to	him,	Yusuf	said,	
“Return	 to	your	lord	and	ask	him	what	is	
the	status	of	the	women	who	had	cut	their	
hands;	 indeed	 my	 Lord	 knows	 their	
deception.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	 bādshāh	 bolā	 unheñ	mere	 pās	le	āao	
to	jab	us	ke	pās	elchi	āayā	kahā	apne	rab	
(bādshāh)	ke	pās	palat	jā	phir	us	se	pooñch	kya	hāl	hai	un	‘auratoñ	ka	jinhoñ	ne	apne	hāth	kāte	
the	be-shak	merā	Rab	un	ka	fareb	jānta	hai.

arabicText: قَالَ مَا خَطْبُكُنَّ إِذْ رَٰوَدتُّنَّ يُوسُفَ عَن نَّفْسِهِۦ ۚ قُلْنَ حَـٰشَ لِلَّهِ مَا عَلِمْنَا عَلَيْهِ مِن سُوٓءٍۢ ۚ قَالَتِ ٱمْرَأَتُ ٱلْعَزِيزِ ٱلْـَٔـٰنَ حَصْحَصَ ٱلْحَقُّ أَنَا۠ رَٰوَدتُّهُۥ عَن نَّفْسِهِۦ وَإِنَّهُۥ لَمِنَ ٱلصَّـٰدِقِينَ
englishTranslationText:
The	king	said,	“O	women!	What	was	your	role	when	you	tried	to	entice	Yusuf?”	They	answered,	
“Purity	is	to	Allah - we	did	not	find	any	immorality	in	him”;	said	the	wife	of	the	governor,	“Now	
the	truth	is	out;	it	was	I	who	tried	to	entice	him,	and	indeed	he	is	truthful.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Bādshāh	 ne	 kahā	 aey	 ‘auratoñ!	 Tumhārā	 kya	 kām	 thā	 jab	 tum	 ne	 Yūsuf ka	 jee	 (dil)	 lubhānā	
chāhā	boliñ	Allāh	ko	pāki	hai	ham	ne	un	meiñ	koi	badi	na	pāyi’aziz	ki	’aurat	boli	ab	asli	bāt	khul	
gayi	maiñ	ne	un	ka	jee	lubhānā	chāhā	thā	aur	woh	be-shak		sachche	haiñ

arabicText: ذَٰلِكَ لِيَعْلَمَ أَنِّى لَمْ أَخُنْهُ بِٱلْغَيْبِ وَأَنَّ ٱللَّهَ لَا يَهْدِى كَيْدَ ٱلْخَآئِنِينَ
englishTranslationText:
Said	Yusuf,	“I	did	this	so	that	the	governor	may	realise	that	I	did	not	betray	him	behind	his	back,	
and	Allah does	not	let	the	deceit	of	betrayers	be	successful.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Yūsuf ne	 kahā	 yeh	maiñ	 ne	is	liye	 kiya	 ke	 ‘aziz	 ko	m’aloom	 ho	jāye	 ke	maiñ	 ne	 peeth	 peeche	
khayānat	na	ki	aur	Allāh	daghā	bāzoñ	ka	makr	nahiñ	chalne	detā.
